meanings.sent1: The magician was occulting the rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent2: She was occulting her treasure in a secret compartment.
meanings.sent3: The spy was caught occulting behind the bushes.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were occulting the moon, casting shadows on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The ninja's stealth was like a cloak, occulting him from his enemies.

meanings.sent1: The occulting mist made it hard to see the path ahead.
meanings.sent2: The dark, occulting cloak made her blend into the night.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had an occulting effect on the audience.
meanings.sent4: The dense fog was like an occulting veil over the city.
meanings.sent5: The shadowy figure had an occulting presence in the room.

meanings.definition: A type of light signal used in navigation, in which a light is regularly obscured at intervals
meanings.sent1: The sailors followed the occulting light to safely navigate the waters.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse had an occulting beacon to guide ships at sea.
meanings.sent3: The curious child was fascinated by the occulting light pattern.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic occulting of the lighthouse warned ships of danger.
meanings.sent5: The mesmerizing occulting of the light helped ships find their way home.
